html:
Click the following link to watch video: https://share.newscasts.refinitiv.com/link?entryId=1_rhru8ikz&referenceId=1_rhru8ikz&pageId=RefinitivNewscasts
Source: Reuters

Description: U.S. producer prices increased more than expected last month as bottlenecks persisted,leading to the biggest annual gain in more than 10 years and supporting views that inflation could remain uncomfortably high for some time.The S&P 500 and the Nasdaq fell more than 1% each in Tuesday trade on the back of those producer price numbers and tomorrow's Fed decision. The Senate has moved toward a vote to raise the federal government's debt limit by $2.5 trillion and forward the measure to the House to avoid an unprecedented default.
Short Link: https://refini.tv/3DWm3ib
